result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance M Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. Through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Defendant currently serving a prison sentence.  To be paid in full by 9/30/2016 or to serve 10 days in HOC, consecutie. Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lance M Hess in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Lance M Hess in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). (Defendant is currently serving a prision sentence.)  To be paid in full by 9/30/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension if not paid in full.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.  aw

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Lance M Hess not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for an adjourned plea and sentence date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 03.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Lance M Hess not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Lance M Hess in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Lance M Hess in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
